name: 7.65×21mm Parabellum
description: .30 Luger, also known as 7.65x21mm, was developed by Hugo Borchardt and Georg Luger originally for Borchardt's pistol, eventually coming to be used in Luger's new pistol. It was the Swiss Army's standard round into the 1940's and continued in civilian use through the SIG P210.

name: 7.65×21mm casing
description: An empty casing from a 7.65×21mm round.
